title: SLOW-COOKED STUFFED PEPPERS RECIPE
directions: Cut and discard tops from peppers; remove seeds. In a large bowl, mix beans, cheese, salsa, onion, corn, rice, chili powder and cumin; spoon into peppers. Place in a 5-qt. slow cooker coated with cooking spray.
Cook, covered, on low 3-4 hours or until peppers are tender and filling is heated through. If desired, serve with sour cream. Yield: 4 servings.
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1/3 cup uncooked converted long grain rice
